title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 March 2016 - XWiki
content:
<Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
00:23 <ujjwal> has quit  
00:59 <abusenius> has quit  
06:44 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:28 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:06 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <mflorea> has quit  
08:31 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:56 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <ujjwal> has quit  
09:51 <vmassol> good morning  
10:06 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <Pbas> Good morning  
10:17 <Pbas> I try to modify the style of my frontpage title without success. If I use "//", "html tag" or "(%" in title, my page title display //, html tag or (% tags :-(  
10:17 <Pbas> My purpose is to write MyTile with M in italic, y with a color and T with another color.  
10:17 <Pbas> (I use xwiki 7.0.1)  
10:17 <Pbas> Do you have a tip to do it? Thxs  
10:18 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <lkrejci> has quit  
10:19 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <vmassol> titles are stripped of markup Pbas (it's parsed as plain text)  
10:22 <Pbas> yes it is my problem. Then I must plaing with style and content maybe  
10:22 <vmassol> if you want to change that, you'll need to use a custom skin and override titlevars.vmvm  
10:22 <vmassol> there's no style in titles  
10:22 <vmassol> it's parsed as plain text  
10:22 <Pbas> \* playing  
10:22 <Pbas> ok  
10:22 <vmassol> #set ($titleToDisplay = $tdoc.getRenderedTitle('xhtml/1.0'))  
10:22 <vmassol> from titlevars.vm  
10:23 <Pbas> I will check titlevars template  
10:23 <Pbas> ha yes right  
10:23 <Pbas> thxs again :)  
10:25 <vmassol> FTR this is where it happens: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/43235afcd791de4d504e3e71ebfc35650a06b79d/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-display/xwiki-platform-display-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/display/internal/AbstractDocumentTitleDisplayer.java#L199-L199  
10:25 <vmassol> btw it seems our javadoc is not correct :(  
10:25 <vmassol> fixing it  
10:25 <Pbas> humm maybe it is "dangerous" if I modify $titleToDisplay (I wanted this particular title for only one page)  
10:26 <Pbas> if a user typing some \* and /// character in title by example  
10:26 <vmassol> the reason we did this is because we display the titles in lots of places  
10:26 <vmassol> like document tree, breadcrumbs, index, etc  
10:27 <vmassol> and having styles there do not make much sense  
10:27 <Pbas> yes of course  
10:27 <vmassol> it's also preventing mistakes yes  
10:27 <vmassol> basically we wanted the title to never fail  
10:28 <Pbas> I will think about it (or propose another solution at my boss)  
10:28 <Pbas> :-D  
10:33 <Pbas> Finally in footerglobal my colored title is probably... nicer and pretty ;-) Thxs  
10:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <ujjwal> has quit  
12:32 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <vmassol> hmm weird, I'm having problems opening a page on exo in object editor mode  
13:06 <vmassol> works fine in inline mode but but doesn't work in object editor  
13:06 <vmassol> keeps waiting  
13:07 <vmassol> something seems to be blocking it  
13:07 <vmassol> could someone try http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Extension/IRC+Bot+Application?editor=object  
13:07 <vmassol> ?  
13:08 <vmassol> hmm works for other pages  
13:09 <vmassol> gdelhumeau, tmortagne, mflorea, Enygma`: could one of you try?  
13:10 <vmassol> ClemensR: hi, I'd very much like your feedback on http://markmail.org/message/jrug6cbbqpia5bx4  
13:10 <vmassol> would be great if you could reply on the list :)  
13:13 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: same problem here on your URL  
13:14 <vmassol> hmm  
13:16 <vmassol> some listener catching the event and not returning?  
13:17 <vmassol> ah no  
13:17 <vmassol> I've exported the page and opened locally  
13:17 <vmassol> there are 2327 objects of type ExtensionDependencyClass in it!  
13:18 <vmassol> actually 825 (they don't start at 1)  
13:18 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/IRC+Bot+Application?xpage=xml works (albeit slow to load)  
13:21 <vmassol> this app has 12 deps, so if you count 70 releases, that's 840 xobjects  
13:21 <vmassol> ok I could edit it by waiting enough  
13:22 <vmassol> there's a scalability issue in the reporting app, opening a jira  
13:24 <vmassol> actually it could be argued that the issue is the object editor which should paginate  
13:35 <vmassol> mflorea: cool but 2.7.0 is not enough for java8 I think right?  
13:35 <vmassol> you're doing it in 2 steps maybe?  
13:35 <mflorea> it builds for me, otherwise I would have upgraded to 2.8  
13:36 <vmassol> with java8?  
13:36 <mflorea> yes, with java 8  
13:36 <vmassol> ah cool  
13:36 <vmassol> wati  
13:36 <vmassol> that's not the issue  
13:36 <vmassol> 2.6 also does  
13:36 <vmassol> :)  
13:36 <vmassol> it needs to work with target and source set to 1.8  
13:36 <mflorea> check the commit, I remove the change you introduced in the pom  
13:36 <vmassol> have you tested that?  
13:37 <mflorea> isn't target and source set to 1.8 by default in our build now?  
13:37 <vmassol> no  
13:37 <vmassol> we're still have it set to 1.7  
13:37 <mflorea> where?  
13:37 <vmassol> and the GWT plugin is one of the blocker  
13:37 <vmassol> top level pom  
13:37 <vmassol> in commons  
13:38 <vmassol> we had clirr as a blocker but I fixed it, now we need to fix GWT  
13:38 <vmassol> and then we can move to 1.8 :)  
13:38 <mflorea> then why did you do https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6d4eb285832b70b6e73f52187c4711fe2087f973  
13:38 <vmassol> becuase 2.6.0 was not build with java 8  
13:39 <vmassol> \*building  
13:39 <mflorea> sure, but if we still have 1.7 in commons,why change the plafform pom?  
13:39 <vmassol> (with target/source set to 1.7)  
13:39 <vmassol> there are 2 different things mflorea  
13:39 <vmassol> - building withg 1.8  
13:39 <vmassol> - requiring java 8 to be the target/source of our generated code  
13:40 <vmassol> the reason is that I've moved the build to revapi  
13:40 <vmassol> and revapi requires buiding with java8  
13:40 <mflorea> I still don't get the purpose of the commits I linked  
13:40 <vmassol> so right now you have to build xwiki with java8  
13:40 <vmassol> I sent a mail on the devs list about it  
13:41 <mflorea> I know all this, I just want to understand the purpose of this commit https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6d4eb285832b70b6e73f52187c4711fe2087f973  
13:41 <vmassol> I told you already  
13:41 <vmassol> without it, the build didn't work with java 8  
13:41 <vmassol> it spits a message like  
13:41 <vmassol> source level must be one of [1.6, 1.7]  
13:41 <mflorea> but the build is not set to java 8 yet  
13:41 <vmassol> grrr  
13:41 <vmassol> again you're confusing 2 things  
13:42 <vmassol> - building with java 8  
13:42 <vmassol> - having target/source set to 1.8  
13:42 <vmassol> revapi requires building with java 8  
13:42 <vmassol> try building xwiki with java 7 if you want to verify that  
13:42 <vmassol> (master)  
13:43 <vmassol> then remove my fix you linked and try building with java 8  
13:43 <vmassol> in any case what we need to is to move to target/source 1.8 and GWT is currently blocking this  
13:43 <vmassol> this is where I need your help  
13:44 <vmassol> see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-878?focusedCommentId=89981&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-89981  
13:45 <vmassol> <offtopic> stoppping bot to upgrade it  
13:47 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <vmassol> mflorea: is it clear? If not, I can ping you privately on skype  
13:48 <M-bobderbaumeist> has left #xwiki  
13:48 <mflorea> it's clear  
13:48 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:48 <vmassol> ok thanks  
13:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <lkrejci> has quit  
13:49 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <mflorea> vmassol: builds with source/target 1.8. "Java 8 syntax is now supported by the compiler" doesn't mean you cannot build old code with Java 8, I means you can use new Java 8 APIs in GWT code starting with GWT 2.8  
13:58 <vmassol> mflorea: 2.7.0 works with target/source set to 1.8?  
13:58 <mflorea> yes  
13:58 <vmassol> ok that's great then  
13:58 <vmassol> :)  
13:59 <vmassol> I'll continue the move to java 8!  
13:59 <vmassol> thanks for your help  
13:59 <mflorea> np  
13:59 <vmassol> I just remember that I still have plenty of tests to fix  
14:03 <vmassol> \*remembered  
14:10 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <Tassoman> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
14:28 <Tassoman> We're evaluating to adopt XWiki as knowledge management software for our intranet  
14:28 <vmassol> Tassoman: cool  
14:28 <Tassoman> They asking me things I found in documentation and mailing list  
14:28 <Tassoman> I can easily answer  
14:29 <Tassoman> but there's one question I can't answer now  
14:29 <Tassoman> so I'm here :p  
14:29 <Tassoman> the question is: can we customize outgoing notification mails?  
14:30 <Tassoman> Then I inform you that Italian translation lacks somewhere and maybe we can contribute in the future  
14:40 <Tassoman> are them notification a "watchlist" ?  
14:42 <vmassol> back, reading  
14:42 <Tassoman> sorry for spamming  
14:42 <vmassol> re italian that would be great if you could help out!  
14:42 <vmassol> it's on http://l10n.xwiki.org  
14:42 <vmassol> you mean customize the mail template for watchlist?  
14:43 <acotiuga> has quit  
14:43 <Tassoman> maybe yes. Watchlist It's the mail with content I'm following?  
14:43 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Watchlist+Application#HAdministrators:CustomizingtheWatchListemailtemplate  
14:43 <vmassol> yes  
14:43 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <Tassoman> oh nice let me see  
14:45 <avisser> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <Tassoman> @vmassol how do I can trigger crontabs about sending notifications?  
14:47 <vmassol> scheduler  
14:50 <vmassol> I have a bug in ComponentAnnotationChecker for rendering-legacy, debugging  
14:52 <vmassol> oh I know  
14:53 <vmassol> I'm reading the wrong components.txt...  
14:53 <vmassol> I'm reading the one from the wrapped module instead of the legacy one...  
14:53 <vmassol> indeed there can be more than one META-INF/components.txt in the CL… fixing  
14:58 <avisser> has quit  
15:00 <acotiuga> Hello! On xwiki.org is it normal that when a extension page is voted, a new page is created to keep that vote ? MoccaCalendar Application has 5 votes and 5 related pages ExtensionMoccaCalendarR1-R5.  
15:01 <msmeria> has quit  
15:01 <avisser> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <vmassol> acotiuga: it's by design AFAIK  
15:02 <vmassol> (in order to scale)  
15:03 <acotiuga> Couldn't be one page to store all the ratings object for an extension page?  
15:04 <vmassol> I guess it wouldn't scale  
15:04 <vmassol> objects don't scale  
15:04 <vmassol> but pages do  
15:04 <vmassol> btw would be nice to improve this app now that we have Nested Spaces :)  
15:04 <vmassol> (app = ratings app)  
15:05 <tmortagne> yes it could store all the vote in the same subspace  
15:05 <acotiuga> Yes, indeed  
15:10 <Tassoman> @vmassol so to customize scheduled watchlist mail we must edit the object: /xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/WatchListMessage?editor=object  
15:10 <vmassol> it' simpler  
15:10 <vmassol> you jsut click edit on the job  
15:10 <vmassol> and you'll get a nicer UI  
15:11 <vmassol> (but yes using the object editor will work too :))  
15:11 <vmassol> and you shoud keep the existing jobs probably but you can create your own one  
15:11 <vmassol> (if need be)  
15:11 <Tassoman> so better choice is to dupe default scheduled object  
15:11 <vmassol> what's your need?  
15:11 <Tassoman> disable original and play with the duped  
15:12 <vmassol> change the time when it's triggered?  
15:12 <vmassol> yes it's better  
15:12 <vmassol> so that you don't change the defaults  
15:12 <Tassoman> no they asked to edit mails content  
15:12 <Tassoman> customize appearance  
15:12 <vmassol> then you don't need to change the jobs at all  
15:12 <vmassol> you shouldn't touch the scheduler  
15:12 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Watchlist+Application#HAdministrators:CustomizingtheWatchListemailtemplate  
15:13 <vmassol> you just need to change the mail template  
15:13 <Tassoman> ok I got it :)  
15:13 <Tassoman> I suggest them to stay with the default huh  
15:14 <Tassoman> maybe they want a logo I bet It's taken by general skin  
15:16 <Tassoman> thank you for support  
15:18 <lkrejci> has quit  
15:19 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <vmassol> yw  
15:24 <Tassoman> I would also thank Lucaa for introducing us in XWiki briefly but clearly during FOSDEM16 :)  
15:24 <Tassoman> have a nice day bb :)  
15:24 <vmassol> ah nice  
15:24 <vmassol> glad that fosdem was useful for xwiki :)  
15:25 <Tassoman> Never heard before  
15:26 <Tassoman> Yup the marketing thing "one gadget for one tweet" was lovely lol bye for real now  
15:26 <Tassoman> has left #xwiki  
15:29 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
16:04 <mrvis> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <avisser> has quit  
16:16 <vmassol> ClemensR: hi  
16:17 <ClemensR> Hi Vmassol!  
16:19 <vmassol> ClemensR: hey, don't know if you saw my message above?  
16:19 <vmassol> (or maybe I missed your answer ;))  
16:19 <ClemensR> no, I did not, sorry  
16:19 <vmassol> 13:10 <vmassol> ClemensR: hi, I'd very much like your feedback on http://markmail.org/message/jrug6cbbqpia5bx4  
16:20 <vmassol> 13:10 <vmassol> would be great if you could reply on the list :)  
16:20 <ClemensR> ah, just foud it :) ... sorry, been distracted most of the time ..  
16:21 <vmassol> np  
16:21 <vmassol> since you participate to contrib and since you're not from xwiki sas it's interesting to have an outside opinion :)  
16:21 <vmassol> (all devs who answered are from xwiki sas so far!)  
16:23 <ClemensR> yes, I noticed. I did not have any ideas so far, but the I have to admit I just skipped over the details :-/  
16:24 <vmassol> as the author of mocca calendar I want to be sure you're ok  
16:24 <vmassol> (with it)  
16:26 <ClemensR> there is no defined release process, or discussion abut the latest supported xwiki-platform version, but I guess all such stuff is just more red tape to scare people away, even though it is my preferred nitpicking playground ;)  
16:27 <ClemensR> ah, no, I see, http://dev.xwiki.org/ applies, it is just more lenitent, so I cannot even complain  
16:28 <vmassol> yes dev.xwiki.org would apply  
16:28 <vmassol> ofc you can complain :)  
16:28 <vmassol> just nicely  
16:28 <vmassol> :)  
16:29 <vmassol> we don't want to scare contributors away...  
16:35 <vmassol> haha  
16:35 <vmassol> the problem I had with rendering legacy and my component anno checker  
16:35 <vmassol> the issue was a bug in rendering legacy!  
16:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: hehe you caused the issue :)  
16:39 <vmassol> fixing it  
16:48 <lkrejci> has quit  
16:49 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
16:49 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne, I had to create a new version for 8.0.1 and since I was editing the jira I had to close it before being able to add the new version I just created (no refresh) and I forgot :)  
16:55 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:57 <vmassol> hmmm I think CarlJ has a good point…. we're missing a new parameter for the documents macro  
16:57 <vmassol> for Nested Spaces  
16:57 <vmassol> some root parameter  
16:57 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:57 <vmassol> I wonder if the "space" param works  
16:57 <vmassol> testing  
17:00 <vmassol> doesn't work :(
